item.title: httpry 0.1.8 available for RHEL and CentOS 7
item.description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux and CentOS 7 users can now install httpry 0.1.8 in EPEL 7 Beta. The new httpry version is also available for RHEL/CentOS 6 and supported Fedora versions (19, 20, 21 branched, and rawhide). Configuring EPEL on a RHEL/CentOS server is easy. Follow the instructions on EPEL’s site and install the epel-release RPM that matches your OS release version. If you haven’t used httpry before, check the output on Jason Bittel’s site.
